I came to this restaurant on the earlier side 9:00 pm without a reservation and was seated immediately.The view from the covered patio was charming and the service was excellent. I shared the Bacalao "esqueixat" and fried calamari. Both had clean simple flavors. Despite my tenancy not to order let alone review a common fried appetizer in the calamari, it was worth noting.  I thoroughly enjoyed the shoulder of baked goat or better known as braise goat shank. My partner praised the hake cheeks in a light lemon cream sauce as excellent. Pricing was on the high side, as many restaurants near the tourist areas tend to be.
